entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 30,572Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 7

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,866Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 5

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn’t be more different. She’s the disciplined “good girl” with her future mapped out, while he’s the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 32,616Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 19

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: I Can Talk You Through Phone Sex..."Platonically"
entry.summary:
Author: ThistleFirethorn

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,000Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: "Buck, I am not calling and paying a stranger for phone sex, just to release some pent-up tension." Eddie's voice was a mix of embarrassment and irritation. "Well, you wouldn't have to pay me," Buck said casually. "W-what?" Eddie's heart skipped a beat, his hand tightening around the phone. "...you?" "Yeah, why not. You know I don't know how to shut up, so it's not like I would run out of things to say." Buck said with a laugh, trying to ease the tension. "I can talk you through it."

entry.title: Superwoman: Last Responder
entry.summary:
Author: That_bitch_without_a_life

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 32,749Chapters: 10/10Kudos: 55

Summary: If anybody were to ask Kara why she chose to be a firefighter she’d tell you that she loves helping humanity and wants to give back to a community who gave so much to her when they so graciously took her in. If Kal El of Krypton asked Kara the same question she’d would’ve already thrown him into the sun, since it was his dumb idea to get her out into the ‘real world’.While there’s truth to the fact she wants to help, there’s nothing humanity has ever given her that she thinks she should pay them back for. Maybe she would help the Themyscirans for their training, however, she was already sufficient back on Krypton having been part of the army for years. But no, the reason Kara choose to be a firefighter was because it was a high energy job on a planet where she annoyingly couldn’t get drunk off her ass and thus needed something to keep her occupied.TLDR: this is a female buck fic if she was supergirl, just trust the process.

entry.title: we're all the things that we do for fun (play along)
entry.summary:
Author: Icantthinkofagoodusername7

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,182Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 62

Summary: He walks up to where Eddie and Bobby are, staring between the two of them, “So, what’s my husband doing in our uniform?” Bobby laughs as he places a hand on Buck’s shoulder, patting it twice, “Good try, Buck, but try not to flirt with your new coworker, yeah?” “Yeah!” Chimney shouts from- wait where did he just come from? One moment he was nowhere to be seen and next thing Buck knows he’s walking down the stairs and chiming into their conversation, “I thought you left that version of Buck behind.” “Anyway,” Bobby cuts in before Buck can say anything to defend his honor, “This is Eddie Diaz, he’ll be joining us for his probationary period starting today.” Buck just blinks a couple of times, looking to Eddie and then back to Bobby, “Yeah- I-” He looks back at Chimney then at Bobby again, “I know who he is? I’m married to him?” “You aren’t wearing a ring,” Chimney points out, “and neither is he. Really, this was a poor attempt at convincing us of your lie, Buck.” It doesn’t make any sense and- Eddie’s laughing. Of course he is. * OR, 5 times the 118 thinks buck and eddie are joking about being married plus the 1 time they realize its true

entry.title: Even the Dead Still Breathe
entry.summary:
Author: BlckOnyx

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 49,450Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 28

Summary: It has been a year since Bobby’s death, and Buck has never been the same. Grief eats at him in quiet ways the rest of the 118 can’t quite reach, so when he announces he’s taking a break and heading abroad, everyone tells themselves he deserves the space. A week later, he disappears. Weeks turn into months, and the people he left behind are forced to believe the unthinkable—that Buck walked away for good. Until the headlines change, and the word “presumed dead” settles over them like ash. What none of them know is that Buck’s story didn’t end there. His grief, his secrets, and the dangerous truth he’s been carrying all lead back to a past no one at the 118 ever imagined. And when the pieces finally surface, the loss they thought they understood becomes something else entirely. How will the 118 deal with losing people they love, only to find out later that it was all a lie? OR Buck disappeared, and the truth might destroy what’s left of the family they built.

entry.title: Interlude on I-10

Author: Bookworm0303

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 35,728Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 955

Summary: Without waiting for a reaction or reply, the man bore down on the gas and peeled down the highway, leaving Buck stranded in the middle of nowhere somewhere along Interstate 10.And as Buck watched the red brake lights of his Jeep disappear into the distance, clutching his prescription of blood thinners tightly to his chest... there was really only one thing left to do. Tilting his head back until he was staring at the stars, he took a deep breath and screamed into the night: “Fuck!” And much like every other one of his recent cries for help, it had gone unanswered.---Buck gets carjacked, held at gunpoint, and stranded in Arizona the day before his first shift post-lawsuit. And that's only the beginning of his troubles.

entry.title: What Came Spilling Out That Day (Was The Truth)
entry.summary:
Author: madame_bingo

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,986Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 99

Summary: God, Eddie was glad he wasn't here. He was glad that if anyone had to be on this plane that it was him and not Buck, or Bobby, or Chim, or Hen. But especially not Buck. Buck, who in less than 24 hours was going to have to explain to Christopher what had happened. Who in less than an hour was going to be his son’s legal guardian and he wouldn't even know it. Buck, who was expecting a call soon.   or   When Eddie's plane goes down, he leaves Buck a voicemail telling him how he feels, after all, he was about to die. Only he didn't die. And when he returns, Buck doesn't say anything about the voicemail and Eddie assumes that mean Buck just isn't interested.
